author: 小浪财讯
title: 智能驾驶ETF（516520）跌0.29%，半日成交额787.30万元|智能驾驶_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，智能驾驶ETF（516520）跌0.29%，报1.028元，成交额787.30万元。智能驾驶ETF（516520）重仓股方面， 立讯精密 截止午盘跌0.58%， 芯原股份 跌2.79%， 拓普集团 涨1.99%， 韦尔股份 涨0.27%， 科大讯飞 跌0.55%， 欧菲光 跌1.52%， 长城汽车 跌0.47%， 德赛西威 涨0.20%， 华域汽车 跌0.39%， 闻泰科技 涨0.29%。
智能驾驶ETF（516520）业绩比较基准为中证智能汽车主题指数收益率，管理人为华泰柏瑞基金管理有限公司，基金经理为谭弘翔，成立（2021-02-09）以来回报为3.26%，近一个月回报为-2.84%。
风险提示：市场有风险，投资需谨慎。本文为AI大模型自动发布，任何在本文出现的信息（包括但不限于个股、评论、预测、图表、指标、理论、任何形式的表述等）均只作为参考，不构成个人投资建议。

author: CNA
title: Liverpool go seven points clear, Chelsea drop points, Man City remain in freefall
text:
MANCHESTER, England :Premier League leaders Liverpool opened up a seven-point gap at the top as they came from a goal down to beat Leicester City 3-1 at Anfield after second-placed Chelsea lost at home to Fulham and Manchester City's woes continued on Thursday.
Arne Slot's Liverpool could not have asked for a better start to a flurry of festive fixtures as goals by Cody Gakpo, Curtis Jones and Mohamed Salah sealed the points.
The victory extended their unbeaten league run to 13 games and put Liverpool on 42 points from 17 games.
Chelsea had earlier surrendered a lead at home to Fulham to lose 2-1 - Rodrigo Muniz scoring for the visitors in the 95th minute for their first victory at Stamford Bridge since 1979.
Enzo Maresca's Chelsea have 35 points from 18 games.
Reigning champions Manchester City could only draw 1-1 at home to Everton with Erling Haaland missing a penalty as Pep Guardiola's side slipped to seventh.
Nottingham Forest moved up to third with a 1-0 victory over Tottenham Hotspur while Manchester United lost for the fourth time in five Premier League games, going down 2-0 at Wolverhampton Wanderers to sit in 14th place.
Liverpool suffered an early shock at a foggy Anfield in the last of the Boxing Day kickoffs with Jordan Ayew giving Leicester a lead in the sixth minute.
Leicester hung on until the stroke of halftime but just after Salah struck the crossbar, Gakpo curled an effort beyond Leicester goalkeeper Jakub Stolarczyk.
Liverpool put Leicester under siege straight from the break and took just four minutes into the second half Jones converted a pass by Alexis Mac Allister. Salah then grabbed his 16th league goal of the season with a trademark finish to wrap it up.
"We cannot deny we are in a good place, but still one of the strengths of the team is we approach each game as a new one," Gakpo said. "That keeps us humble."
CHELSEA DROP POINTS
Chelsea took the lead after Cole Palmer danced past two defenders and slid the ball through Issa Diop's legs.
But Fulham equalised in the 82nd minute when Harry Wilson headed home from close range before substitute Muniz clinched all three points for Fulham at the death.
It was Chelsea's first league loss since a 2-1 defeat on Oct. 20 by Liverpool.
Guardiola's City have now managed only one win in 13 games in all competitions as their crisis showed no sign of ending.
Bernardo Silva put them ahead in the 14th minute but Iliman Ndiaye levelled before Haaland missed a penalty.
"Incredible how (City players) run and fight and do everything. Some games have not been good, but today, the case was it was well played," Guardiola said.
"But football is about winning, football is about you score goals and you don't concede. The last month, month and a half, we are not able to do it."
FOREST'S MARCH UP TABLE CONTINUES
Forest continued their unlikely challenge for a top-four spot as Anthony Elanga's first-half goal secured a win over Spurs to put them third.
Elanga completed a superb Forest counter-attack in the 28th minute to settle a contest that Tottenham ended with 10 men after former Forest player Djed Spence was sent off. Tottenham's fourth defeat in five Premier League games left them in 11th.
"The belief is here but the belief doesn't hide the reality. The reality says we haven't achieved nothing yet," Forest manager Nuno Espirito Santo, whose team have 34 points, said.
Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim left Marcus Rashford out of his fourth successive squad and his side were undermined at Wolves as captain Bruno Fernandes was sent off just after halftime for a second yellow card.
Matheus Cunha then scored direct from a corner and then teed up Hwang Hee-chan in stoppage time to seal United's fate.
Wolves marked manager Vitor Pereira's first home game in charge by moving out of the relegation zone.
NEWCASTLE CRUSH VILLA
Anthony Gordon, Alexander Isak and Joelinton scored in Newcastle's rout of 10-man Villa, climbing to fifth in the table with their third straight league win while Villa slip to ninth.
Gordon curled Newcastle ahead early on and Villa striker Jhon Duran was red-carded in the 32nd minute after a stamp on Fabian Schar following a tackle.
Newcastle doubled their lead in the 59th minute when Jacob Murphy squared the ball to Isak for a tap-in and Joelinton completed the rout in stoppage time.
Jarrod Bowen scored the only goal as West Ham United beat bottom club Southampton 1-0 to move his side up to 13th in the table.
An uninspired Bournemouth slipped to sixth after being held to goalless draw by Crystal Palace.

author: VNExplorer
title: Lee Sun-kyun, 'Parasite' star, passes away at 48
text:
Photo: Lee Sun-kyun, recognized for ‘Parasite,’ passes away at 48 (GettyImages)
South Korean actor Lee Sun-kyun, known for his role in the Oscar-winning film “Parasite”, has been found dead at the age of 48. The actor was discovered unconscious in a car in Seoul, with the circumstances surrounding his death still unclear, according to BBC.
Lee Sun-kyun’s death comes amidst a drug investigation against him since October, involving allegations of marijuana and ketamine use. He had undergone extensive police questioning and had requested a lie detector test through his lawyer.
Despite his drug tests returning negative or inconclusive, the investigation significantly impacted his public image and career.
Lee, a family man with a previously clean image, was dropped from a TV series and saw his endorsements removed. His agency has urged the public to refrain from speculation and respect his final journey.
Legal consequences
Internationally, Mr. Lee gained significant recognition for his role in the 2019 thriller “Parasite,” portraying the patriarch of a rich family around whose home the film is centered. “Parasite” achieved notable success, winning four Oscars in 2020, including Best Picture. It was the first non-English film to receive this prestigious award.
Lee Sun-kyun in ‘Parasite’ (Photo: Mashable ME)
His case reflects South Korea’s stringent stance on drug offenses, where even marijuana use can lead to prison sentences. The country’s president has recently intensified efforts against drug crimes amidst other high-profile drug investigations in the South Korean entertainment industry.
This strict approach has often led to significant public and professional consequences for celebrities involved in such allegations.
In recent months, several talented and famous people have passed away, such as Norman Lear, Ralph Cirella, Friends star Matthew Perry, Andre Braugher, iconic Captain Holt, and Doctor Who actor Richard Franklin.

author: Ricardo Guadarrama/Corresponsal
title: Como pan caliente: Vacuna COVID-19 se agota en solo 20 minutos en Cruz Roja de Toluca
text: En solo 20 minutos, la demanda de la [vacuna COVID-19](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/nacional/2023/12/26/vacuna-covid-19-donde-me-sale-mas-barato-comprarla/) terminó con las 100 dosis del biológico Pfizer que adquirió la [Cruz Roja Mexicana](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/estados/2023/12/21/vacuna-covid-de-pfizer-en-que-sedes-de-la-cruz-roja-se-venderan-las-dosis-mas-baratas/) a través de su delegación en Toluca, sin embargo, la vacunación se reanudará hasta el próximo martes 2 de enero de 2024, ya que el laboratorio norteamericano no surtió el pedido completo. También de forma pronta, la vacuna se terminó en las delegaciones de la benemérita institución situadas en los municipios de Naucalpan y Cuautitlán México, así como en las instalaciones de Lilas, en la alcaldía de Cuajimalpa y en el Hospital Central de Polanco, en la capital del país. Es de señalar que, en este primer día no hubo [vacuna pediátrica](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/salud/2023/03/15/vacuna-bivalente-covid-de-pfizer-eu-autoriza-aplicacion-en-ninos/) para los pequeños, pues la farmacéutica no surtió. Se explicó que será hasta el martes 2 de enero de 2024 cuando se continúe acercando a la población dicha vacuna una vez que los laboratorios regularicen la entrega. “Tuvimos vacunas para el día de hoy (jueves), no fue el número que requerimos, fue solamente el 10 por ciento del pedido original y eso nos permitió al menos poder estar cumpliendo con el compromiso, de iniciar con la aplicación de vacunas aquí en la delegación Toluca y en las delegaciones de Cruz Roja en el Estado de México y Ciudad de México”, indicó Mario Vázquez de la Torre, presidente de la Cruz Roja Mexicana delegación Toluca. Entre la larga fila de personas que se dio cita a la delegación de la Cruz Roja Mexicana en Toluca, estaba el señor Carlos Martínez, quien dio importancia a estar protegidos contra el nuevo coronavirus, lo malo, añadió, es que actualmente es muy complicado conseguir esta vacuna. “Es una protección indispensable para los tiempos que vivimos, hay que estar protegidos contra este virus del COVID, está muy complicado conseguir una vacuna actualmente”, sostuvo el poblador originario de Toluca. Al encontrar al señor José Faustino García, subrayó que si bien recibió de forma gratuita todas sus vacunas contra esta enfermedad cuando estuvieron las campañas en tiempos complicados de pandemia, ahora hay que pagar para seguir viviendo. “Pues nada más para un refuerzo del COVID que está, que todavía no se termina, sigue, pues está exagerado, pero lo tenemos que pagar si queremos seguir, ahora sí, que viviendo todas las tengo, todas las vacunas desde que empezó la pandemia”. Norma Leticia Peralta coincidió con los señores Carlos y José, de que hay que seguirse cuidando para evitar algún posible contagio, “yo considero que la enfermedad, el COVID no es una cuestión de juego y si hay vacuna hay que reforzarnos y hay que cuidarnos”. Vacuna para las personas discapacitadas y de la tercera edad Vázquez de la Torre anunció que la próxima semana, solo en la delegación Toluca, se implementará un mecanismo para [aplicar la vacuna de COVID-19 en las casas donde haya personas discapacitadas o de la tercera edad](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/salud/2022/04/14/tercera-dosis-de-vacuna-covid-eleva-anticuerpos-en-ninos-de-5-a-11-anos-afirma-pfizer/), cuyo costo oscilará los 900 pesos, es decir, 115 pesos más de la aplicación normal que se hace en las instalaciones de la Cruz Roja. “Sobre todo para estas personas que tienen problemas de movilidad, personas de la tercera edad que están postrados en casa o que tienen dificultades para poderse trasladar, será un servicio que estaremos implementando a partir de la siguiente semana. Va a tener un costo adicional, posiblemente será de 900 pesos, con una diferencia de 115 pesos a la que se aplica aquí en la Cruz Roja de Toluca. Tenemos calculado que estaremos aplicando 50 por día, pero va a depender de la demanda”, externó el también paramédico.

author: Hinckley Allen
title: The 2024 Year in Review: Cybersecurity, AI, and Privacy Developments
text:
2024 was a record-breaking year for the wrong reasons, as it unfortunately involved the largest and most destructive data breaches. These data breaches affected companies of all sizes and in every sector, costing the United States billions of dollars in damages. The major 2024 cyberattacks ranged from high-profile ransomware attacks crippling Change Healthcare and software maker CDK Global to the exploitation of a high severity zero-day vulnerability in Ivanti’s VPNs affecting thousands of users, the hijacking of hundreds of routers by both Russian and Chinese/PRC government-sponsored hackers, and the massive theft of data from Snowflake customer accounts using stolen credentials. According to IBM’s 2024 Cost of Data Breach Report, the average total cost of a data breach in the United States was $9.36 million, and the most common causes of a data breach were phishing and the use of stolen or compromised credentials.
2024 also saw the expansion of cybersecurity regulations, including new breach notification requirements by the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (“FTC”). Federal agencies, especially the U.S. Department of Justice (“DOJ”), U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (“SEC”), and FTC, are aggressively enforcing cybersecurity regulations and data privacy rights. These enforcement actions have been far-reaching and have demonstrated that corporate executives, as well as the corporate entity itself, could be held liable for mishandling cyberattacks, failing to implement adequate internal controls, and violating consumers’ privacy rights. Federal agencies have also begun bringing AI-related enforcement actions arising from deceptive and misleading disclosures that misrepresent the capabilities of AI tools and how AI tools are actually being used as well as the misuse of AI tools.
Nineteen states have now passed and enacted comprehensive data privacy laws, most of which are modeled after the European Union’s General Data Protection Regulation. States continue to revise and modify their data breach laws making them more stringent and complex. This has created an increasingly complex patchwork of state data privacy and data breach laws due to the lack of federal legislation.
Similarly, in the absence of federal Artificial Intelligence (“AI”) legislation, states have also started to fill this void in a patchwork manner. On May 17, 2024, Colorado became the first state to enact comprehensive AI legislation, which goes into effect in 2026. This law is groundbreaking and follows the same risk classification approach of the EU AI Act, and, among other things, imposes a duty of reasonable care on developers and deployers of high-risk AI systems to prevent algorithmic discrimination.[1] California, Illinois, Maryland, and New York City have also passed AI laws. Of particular significance is California’s Physicians Make Decisions Act, which went into effect on January 1, 2025 and ensures that decisions about medical treatments are made by health care providers, not solely determined by AI algorithms
Here are the five top cybersecurity, AI, and privacy developments in 2024:
Nearly 170 million people in the United States had their health data compromised in 2024 according to data security incident reports made to U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (“HHS”). 2024 began with the largest data breach of healthcare data ever reported compromising the protected health information and personal information of approximately 100 million individuals. The February 2024 ransomware attack of Change Healthcare, owned by UnitedHealth Group, crippled the U.S. healthcare system causing mass disruptions throughout the country. Change Healthcare was unable to process insurance claims and prescriptions for months. Hackers also stole patient data and reportedly offered the stolen healthcare data for sale on the dark web despite United Health Group having made a $22 million ransom payment to the ransomware group, BlackCat a/k/a ALPHV.
Similarly, hackers frequently targeted hospitals in 2024, creating significant threats to public safety when hospitals were forced to shut down, delay procedures, divert patients, and increase wait times in emergency rooms. Indeed, in May 2024, a ransomware attack disrupted the operations of Ascension Health Alliance, which operates approximately 140 hospitals in 19 states and Washington, D.C. Hospitals are often targeted because they have a broad attack surface and rely upon older, legacy systems that are difficult to update with cybersecurity safeguards and easier for hackers to penetrate. But even more troubling, hackers target hospitals and health care systems because they are more likely to pay a ransom because lives are at stake.
As a result of the increasing frequency and sophistication of cyberattacks on the health care sector, U.S regulators and lawmakers have proposed new cybersecurity rules to address this problem. On December 27, 2024, HHS proposed an overhaul and update to the HIPAA security rule comprising hundreds of pages of new regulations and safeguards to better protect the U.S. healthcare system from the increasing number of cyberattacks.[2] Among other things, these rules would require encryption of electronic protected health information (“ePHI”) at rest and in transit, the use of multi-factor authentication, network segmentation, vulnerability scanning at least every six months, and penetration testing and compliance audits at least once every 12 months.
AI tools have supercharged cyberattacks allowing threat actors to scan, identify, and weaponize vulnerabilities in target networks far quicker than ever before. AI tools have also been used to craft more persuasive phishing emails, create voice clones to orchestrate fraud schemes, and develop malicious code and new variants of malware that is less likely to be detected by cybersecurity tools. Cybercriminals have used AI tools to automate large-scale ransomware and phishing campaigns. Further, nation states have begun weaponizing large language models for cyberattacks. In short, AI has already drastically changed the threat landscape and has enabled criminals to commit fraud on a much larger scale.[3]
AI’s largest impact to date has been in the area of phishing attacks. According to SlashNext’s 2024 Phishing Intelligence Report, in the second half of 2024, there was a 202% increase in the total phishing messages and a 703% increase in credential phishing attacks.[4] Because phishing attacks are the most common ransomware vector, this is extremely alarming.
On August 22, 2024, in an unprecedented move, DOJ filed its first civil complaint under its Civil Cyber Fraud Initiative – a 99-page civil complaint-in-intervention against Georgia Institute of Technology (“Georgia Tech”) and Georgia Tech Research Corp. (“GTRC”) for failing to comply with cybersecurity requirements in its U.S. Department of Defense (“DoD”) contracts and violating the False Claims Act (“FCA”). Specifically, the complaint alleges that Georgia Tech failed to develop and implement a system security plan, failed to use anti-virus and anti-malware tools on the relevant devices, servers, and networks, and submitted a false cybersecurity assessment score to DoD. DOJ took over a whistleblower FCA lawsuit brought by two former senior members of Georgia Tech’s cybersecurity team and is seeking hundreds of millions of dollars in damages for violations of the FCA as well as breach of contract, fraud, negligent misrepresentation, unjust enrichment, and payment by mistake claims. Through this action, DOJ has issued a stark warning to government contractors and academia that cybersecurity is critical to the U.S. national defense and cybersecurity noncompliance will no longer be tolerated.
DOJ established the Civil Cyber-Fraud Initiative in October 2021 with the intent to use the FCA to hold government contractors accountable for putting U.S. information and systems at risk by knowingly: (1) providing deficient cybersecurity products or services; (2) misrepresenting cybersecurity practices or protocols; or (3) failing to monitor and report cybersecurity incidents and breaches. DOJ’s decision to the use the FCA to enforce cybersecurity compliance was significant as it provides the government the means to recover treble damages while also incentivizing company insiders to report any cyber-related fraud. Since October 2021, DOJ has announced eight settlements (Comprehensive Health Services, Aerojet, JellyBean Communications, Verizon, Insight Global, Guidehouse, Nan Kay & Assoc., ASRC Federal Data Solution LLC and Pennsylvania State University) totaling nearly $30 million under the Civil Cyber Fraud Initiative. To date, DOJ’s investigations and settlements under this initiative have focused on compliance with cybersecurity requirements contained in federal contracts and subcontracts and failing to properly secure personally identifiable information (PII). Most recently on October 22, 2024, Penn State agreed to pay $1.25 million to resolve allegations that it violated cybersecurity requirements in 15 DoD and NASA contracts.
In 2024, U.S. governmental agencies have disclosed troubling details about several Chinese state-sponsored cyber campaigns involving Advanced Persistent Threat (“APT”) groups including, Volt Typhoon, Flax Typhoon, and Salt Typhoon. Volt Typhoon compromised numerous IT networks in the U.S. and was prepositioning itself to cause mass destruction to critical infrastructure in the event of a conflict with the U.S. The damage caused by Salt Typhoon’s infiltration of at least nine U.S. broadband providers, including AT&T, Verizon, and Lumen Technologies, has been described as “potentially catastrophic” as it allowed the PRC hackers to assess court-authorized wiretapping data, which may have provided the PRC insight on U.S. national security investigations,[5] and also gave the PRC hackers broad and full access to surveil telephone calls, text messages, and call record data of the targeted individuals. The full scope of who was targeted by the Chinese hackers is unknown, but Anne Neuberger, President Biden’s Deputy National Security Advisor for Cyber and Emerging Technologies, revealed that China targeted senior U.S. politicians in this cyberespionage campaign. In response to Salt Typhoon, the Federal Communications Commission has proposed stricter cybersecurity rules for telecom operators.
Most recently, on December 30, 2024, U.S. Treasury Officials announced a “major” data breach of its network orchestrated by Chinese state-sponsored hackers. The hackers compromised a “key” used by a third-party software service provider, BeyondTrust, and were able to remotely access unclassified documents on workstations of the Treasury Department.[6] At this time, the U.S. Department of Treasury does not know the full impact of this incident according to a letter it sent to Congress.
As a result of concerns involving China’s increasing cyberattacks on the United States and the weaponization of U.S. personal and governmental data by U.S. foreign adversaries, on December 27, 2024, DOJ established a new national security program within DOJ’s National Security Division that prevents six “countries of concern” from gaining access to bulk sensitive U.S. personal data as well as U.S. government-related data under the authority of the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (“IEEPA”).[7] This new program is far-reaching and creates new prohibitions, reporting requirements, and compliance obligations for U.S. persons, including entities organized under the laws of the United States, that carries significant criminal penalties (i.e., 20 years imprisonment and $1 million dollar fine) for violations. This development underscores the importance of data in our evolving digital ecosystem and that the control over data is directly tied to U.S. national security.[8]
Thousands of class actions involving data security and privacy violations, including lawsuits based upon third-party website tracking tools, were filed in 2024. These lawsuits often coincide with enforcement actions by federal and state regulators and can be extremely costly. Indeed, National Public Data, the Florida business that was responsible for one of the largest data breaches affecting hundreds of millions of people in the United States, Canada, and the United Kingdom, filed for bankruptcy last fall. It is facing more than a dozen class-action lawsuits and investigations by the FTC and more than 20 state regulators.
In October 2024, the SEC announced settlements of nearly $7 million with four public companies for issuing misleading public disclosures after learning that they were victims of a supply chain cyberattack that “negligently minimized” the cybersecurity incident and intentionally downplayed the material cybersecurity risks and impact on business operations. Additionally, in October 2024, the FTC and the Attorney Generals for 49 states and the District of Columbia jointly announced a $52 million dollar settlement with Marriott International, Inc. and its subsidiary Starwood Hotels and Resorts Worldwide LLC resulting from its failure to implement reasonable data security that led to three large data breaches from 2014 to 2020 impacting more than 344 million customers worldwide. Data breach related securities class action filings also rose sharply in 2024 as did the settlements, which exceeded $550 million.
[1]See Colorado Artificial Intelligence Act, available at https://leg.colorado.gov/bills/sb24-205.
[2]See HIPAA Security Rule Fact Sheet, available at https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/security/hipaa-security-rule-nprm/factsheet/index.html.
[3]See FBI’s Public Service Announcement, Dec. 3, 2024, Criminal Use Generative Artificial Intelligence to Facilitate Financial Fraud, available at https://www.ic3.gov/PSA/2024/PSA241203.
[4]See Alessandro Mascellino, Phishing Attacks Double in 2024, Infosecurity Magazine, Dec. 18, 2024, available at https://www.infosecurity-magazine.com/news/2024-phishing-attacks-double/.
[5]See Sarah Krouse, et al., U.S. Wiretap Systems Targeted in China-Linked Hack, WSJ, Oct. 5, 2024, available at Exclusive | U.S. Wiretap Systems Targeted in China-Linked Hack – WSJ.
[6]See Raphael Satter and A.J. Vicens, U.S. Treasury says Chinese Hacker Stole Documents in ‘Major Incident, Reuters, Dec. 31, 2024, available at https://www.reuters.com/technology/cybersecurity/us-treasurys-workstations-hacked-cyberattack-by-china-afp-reports-2024-12-30/.
DOJ Press Release, available at .
[8]See B. Stephanie Siegmann, US Launches Counterattack in Battle Over Data, Export Compliance Manager, Mar. 19, 2024 (summarizing earlier proposal of DOJ, advanced notice of proposed ruling to implement Executive Order 14117), available at https://www.hinckleyallen.com/publications/us-launches-counterattack-in-battle-over-data/.
[9]See DOJ Updated Evaluation of Corporate Compliance Program, Sept. 23, 2024, available at https://www.justice.gov/criminal/criminal-fraud/page/file/937501/dl.
[View source.]

author: José Luis Zaragozá
title: La indústria auxiliar advertix del risc de deslocalització empresarial en l’automoció “en zones inundables”
text:
AUTOMÒBIL
La indústria auxiliar advertix del risc de deslocalització empresarial en l’automoció “en zones inundables”
El president del clúster de l’automoció, Francisco Segura, assegura que els ERTO augmentaran en el sector pel retard dels models elèctrics en Ford i altres marques
Grupo Antolín entra en pèrdues per la caiguda de vendes i el lent enlairament del cotxe elèctric
El president del clúster valencià de l’automoció-AVIA, Francisco Segura, advertix del risc de deslocalització d’indústries situades en este territori “en zones inundables” i aquelles que no siguen capaces de recuperar la seua capacitat de producció després de l’impacte de la DANA. El també conseller delegat de l’empresa de components de l’automòbil F. Segura —que compta amb Ford Almussafes entre els seus principals clients— es pronuncia així a l’hora de fer balanç de la situació actual d’empreses proveïdores de l’automoció, de la qual algunes firmes situades en localitats de l’Horta Sud i la Ribera han patit el cessament d’activitat i s’han acollit a expedients de regulació temporal d’ocupació (ERTO).
Francisco Segura, durant la seua intervenció en Les noticies del matí d’À Punt, ha comentat que es pot produir un “buit industrial” a la Comunitat Valenciana perquè els fabricants d’automòbils “buscaran proveïdors alternatius” fora de l’autonomia. El dirigent del Grupo F. Segura ha insistit que ja hi ha casos d’empreses (encara que no ha concretat noms) “que no volen estar en terrenys inundables i que possiblement se n’aniran d’Espanya”.
Desindustrialització
El sector auxiliar de l’automòbil ha retallat la seua capacitat de producció per la caiguda de vendes de vehicles, sobretot pel lent procés de l’electrificació. En eixe sentit, el màxim responsable d’AVIA sosté que, “sense ajudes directes, serà impossible recuperar el teixit industrial” després del devastador impacte del temporal del passat 29 d’octubre. En la seua opinió, la Comunitat Valenciana està en un “procés de desindustrialització greu” i que la DANA pot portar algunes empreses a “tancar definitivament”. I ha reconegut que la sol·licitud d’ERTO continuarà durant els pròxims mesos.
En al·lusió a Ford Almussafes, Francisco Segura ha lamentat que es passe de fabricar 400.000 vehicles a l’any a poc més de 100.000 unitats, que és la quantitat que la multinacional de l’oval blau fabricarà enguany a València, amb un únic model: el Kuga.
Antolín entra en pèrdues
Una companyia que es veu afectada per la desacceleració de les vendes i el lent enlairament del cotxe elèctric és Grupo Antolín, proveïdor de Ford, entre altres firmes, que ha registrat unes pèrdues de 12,8 milions fins a setembre, enfront dels guanys obtinguts en el mateix període de 2023 de 8,1 milions d’euros, segons les xifres presentades per la companyia este dimecres. Les vendes han disminuït un 10 % en els primers nou mesos de l’any, “en un entorn marcat per la caiguda de la producció de nous vehicles a escala global”, assegura esta corporació. Amb tot, “el pla de transformació, que imposa un control estricte de costos i millora de l’eficiència, aconseguix compensar l’impacte de la disminució d’ingressos”.
Les vendes es van reduir un 10,2 %, fins a 3.174,7 milions d’euros, marcades per l’augment de la incertesa en el sector de l’automòbil. La producció de vehicles a escala mundial va començar l’any en una situació d’atonia, i ha evolucionat a la baixa amb el pas dels mesos. L’objectiu de cara als pròxims mesos és que el programa de transformació continue impulsant la millora de marges per a compensar l’impacte de la disminució d’ingressos que implica un context com l’actual, a més de preparar la companyia per al moment en què el mercat torne a créixer amb solidesa. En els primers nou mesos, Antolín ha aconseguit acords per desinversions per valor de 119 milions d’euros, la qual cosa suposa prop del 80 % de l’objectiu anunciat en el seu pla de desinversions i que ascendia a 150 milions entre 2024 i 2025.
Suscríbete para seguir leyendo
El ministre Óscar Puente repara un túnel negat després de l’avís d’un veí d’AlfafarEl PSOE s’abraça a Zapatero en el seu congrés i visibilitza la ruptura amb un absent Felipe GonzálezMés de 22 quilòmetres de retencions a València després de dos accidentsEstes són les noves ajudes per la DANA: fins a 10.000 euros per a comprar un cotxeMazón no va tindre el seu nucli dur al seu costat la vesprada de la DANAMetrovalencia reobrirà el 6 de desembre, o abans, amb freqüències de dissabtesPampols s’estrena en les Corts sense aplaudiments i amb el seu sou en el focus“Els afectats per la DANA s’enfronten a una etapa d’abandó i soledat”

author: Notimerica
title: Portugal vence a Croacia en la Liga de Naciones con otro récord goleador de Cristiano Ronaldo
text: MADRID, 5 Sep. (EUROPA PRESS) - La selección portuguesa masculina de fútbol ha ganado este jueves por 2-1 a la de Croacia durante la primera jornada del Grupo A1 en la Liga de Naciones, incluyendo otro récord goleador de Cristiano Ronaldo, mientras que Dinamarca ha vencido por 2-0 a Suiza en el Grupo A4, donde también están los combinados de España y de Serbia. En el Estádio da Luz (Lisboa), Diogo Dalot adelantó pronto a los locales en el marcador. Nuno Mendes pasó el balón a Bruno Fernandes, quien desde el pico izquierdo del área rival metió un pase al desmarque de su compañero entre los centrales; en el punto de penalti, Dalot domó la pelota con la diestra y marcó gracias a un tiro raso con la zurda. Cumplida la media hora, Nuno Mendes centró al corazón del área croata y el veterano Cristiano Ronaldo ganó la espalda de Marin Pongracic, para volear de primeras con el interior de su pie derecho y batir a bocajarro al guardameta Dominik Livakovic. Antes del descanso, Croacia redujo distancias con un remate de Borna Sosa que Dalot desvió hacia su propia portería en su intento de despeje. Sin embargo, Portugal conservó dicho resultado hasta el pitido final y consumó su victoria para que 'CR7' pudiese celebrar los 900 goles que ya ha marcado en toda su carrera profesional. Primeros tres puntos para los pupilos de Roberto Martínez en este ajustado Grupo A1. De hecho, en el otro encuentro, Polonia derrotó 'in extremis' por 2-3 a Escocia. Un zurdazo lejano de Sebastian Szymanski, en el minuto 8, botó en el suelo y tocó en el poste antes de entrar en el arco defendido por Angus Gunn. Luego se anuló un gol a Scott McTominay, por mano previa en su control, y en el 44' el culé Robert Lewandowski hizo de penalti el 0-2. A los 22 segundos de empezar la segunda mitad del partido, Billy Gilmour anotó el 1-2 con un derechazo raso tras un barullo en el área rival. McTominay consiguió el 2-2, en el 76', al rematar por abajo en el área polaca un pase de Anthony Ralston desde la banda derecha. Pero la alegría de Hampden Park se esfumó en el 90+7'. Nicola Zalewski marcó el gol del triunfo de Polonia al transformar un penalti que él había provocado, por una falta de Grant Hanley. Esta buena cosecha puso al conjunto polaco también con tres puntos y en el coliderato de su grupo junto a Portugal. Por otra parte, dentro del Grupo A4, el Parken Stadion fue testigo del 2-0 entre daneses y suizos. La insistencia local obtuvo premio al final, a pesar de que el equipo visitante estaba con un jugador menos en el 50', debido a la roja directa que vio Nico Elvedi por derribar a Kasper Dolberg en un contraataque cuando era el último defensor. El joven Patrick Dorgu, al minuto de haber hecho su debut con la selección absoluta de Dinamarca, aprovechó un pase involuntario de Andreas Skov Olsen para marcar con un derechazo raso dentro del área. Ya con otro expulsado en sus filas, por la doble amarilla que recibió Granit Xhaka, Suiza encajó a la contra el 2-0 de Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg. Liderato de grupo para la selección danesa con estos tres primeros puntos, mientras que España y Serbia suman solo un punto a raíz de su igualada a cero en el Estadio Rajko Mitic de Belgrado. En la jornada 2, la 'Roja' acudirá a Ginebra para enfrentarse al combinado helvético. Mientras, en la División C, un doblete del exjugador 'txuri-urdin' Alexander Isak guio la victoria de Suecia por 1-3 contra Azerbaiyán. Además, Eslovaquia venció en su visita a Estonia por 0-1, gracias a un gol de Tomas Suslov mediada la segunda parte del encuentro. Así, suecos y eslovacos colideran ese Grupo C1 con tres puntos cada uno. El Grupo C3 también arrancó este jueves, con triunfo y liderato para Irlanda del Norte después de su 2-0 ante Luxemburgo con dianas de Paddy McNair (11') y de Daniel Ballard (17'). En el otro duelo, Bielorrusia y Bulgaria empataron sin goles en la ciudad de Zalaegerszeg (Hungría). Por último, en la División D, el combinado de San Marino se impuso por 1-0 al de Liechtenstein gracias a un tanto de Nicko Sensoli en el minuto 53. Eso valió a los sanmarinenses para sumar tres puntos y situarse de manera provisional en la cúspide del Grupo D1.

author: ANI
title: Dense fog causes visibilty woes; several Delhi-bound trains delayed | Headlines
text: Dense fog causes visibilty woes; several Delhi-bound trains delayed As dense fog has gripped the national capital and visibility is low, 11 Northern Railway trains that are bound for Delhi have been delayed on Friday. [ANI](https://www.devdiscourse.com/ani-stories)| Updated: 29-12-2023 09:36 IST | Created: 29-12-2023 09:36 IST - Country: - India As dense fog grips the national capital leading to low visibility, at least 11 Delhi-bound trains have been delayed on Friday. "Trains arriving late in Delhi area dated December 29 are Mumbai CSMT-Amritsar Express, Farakka Express, Himachal Express, Brahmaputra Mail, MCTM Udhampur-Delhi Sarai Rohilla AC SF Express, Lucknow Mail, Danapur-Anand Vihar Terminal Jan Sadharan Express, Raxaul-Anand Vihar Terminal Sadbhavana Express, Jammu Mail, Padmavat Express and Kashi Vishwanath Express," Deepak Kumar CPRO, Northern Railways said. A passenger Subhash said, "Several trains are getting delayed. 8 trains that were supposed to reach last night have not yet arrived. The trains that were supposed to reach this morning are running late by almost 3-4 hours and there is no confirmation when these trains will arrive." Several trains were delayed and cancelled at Anand Vihar Railway Station due to dense fog. Another passenger Prashant Kumar said, "The trains are running late than usual this time. I started on Wednesday at 1.30 pm by Nandankanan Express coming to Delhi from Bhubaneswar. The train got delayed from Deendayal Upadhyaya junction. I was supposed to reach at 3.30 pm but it reached Delhi at 12.30 am today." An INSAT (Indian National Satellite System) imagery released by the Met department on Thursday depicted fog hovering over the North India region. The satellite image taken at 14:30 hrs (IST) on Thursday, showed a fog layer continuing over Punjab, Haryana, extreme north Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, and northwest Madhya Pradesh. IMD warned of a dense fog warning over Haryana, Punjab for the next 4 days in a post on X. In Uttar Pradesh, IMD predicted dense fog for the next 2 days. The UP State Road Transport Corporation issues guidelines for fog and restricted bus operations in low visibility conditions. The IMD also warned of possible health impacts on people due to the dense fog in the national capital. "Dense fog contains particulate matter and other pollutants and in case exposed it gets lodged in the lungs, clogging them and decreasing their functional capacity." (ANI) (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.) - READ MORE ON: - [North India](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=North+India) - [Raxaul-Anand Vihar Terminal](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Raxaul-Anand+Vihar+Terminal) - [Amritsar Express](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Amritsar+Express) - [MCTM Udhampur-Delhi](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=MCTM+Udhampur-Delhi) - [INSAT](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=INSAT) - [Delhi](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Delhi) - [Lucknow Mail](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Lucknow+Mail) - [Jammu Mail](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Jammu+Mail) - [Trains](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Trains) - [Deendayal Upadhyaya](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Deendayal+Upadhyaya) - [Haryana](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Haryana) - [Indian National Satellite System](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Indian+National+Satellite+System) - [Punjab](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Punjab) - [Farakka Express](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Farakka+Express) - [Danapur-Anand Vihar Terminal](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Danapur-Anand+Vihar+Terminal) - [Northern Railways](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Northern+Railways) - [north Rajasthan](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=north+Rajasthan) - [Anand Vihar Railway Station](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Anand+Vihar+Railway+Station) - [UP State Road Transport Corporation](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=UP+State%0aRoad+Transport+Corporation) - [Sadbhavana Express](https://www.devdiscourse.com/news?tag=Sadbhavana+Express)

author: Óscar Chan
title: Queda corta expectativa turística en Yucatán
text:
Queda corta expectativa turística en Yucatán
La titular de la Sefotur, Michelle Fridman, confirma que se ha tenido una disminución en algunos indicadores en estas vacaciones, como en el hotelero, transporte y restaurantero.
A pesar de que se tenían buenos “ánimos” en la temporada vacacional de verano, la Secretaría de Fomento Turístico (Sefotur) confirmó que en este período se ha tenido una disminución en algunos indicadores, como el transporte carretero, hotelero y restaurantero; pero señaló que tiene que ver más con un contexto nacional y la desaceleración de los mercados internacionales.
La titular de la Sefotur, Michelle Fridman Hirsch, señaló que esta desaceleración obedece a factores ajenos y que se ven influenciados por lo que atraviesa Estados Unidos (elecciones y campañas), así como a una menor inversión en la promoción de los destinos.
“Tenemos más recaudación que nunca, tenemos 222 por ciento más recaudación de impuestos, sin embargo fue una decisión de los cuatro miembros del fideicomiso de la iniciativa privada de no usar el recurso en las campañas presentadas y eso nos obligó a cancelar campañas con agencias de viajes, socios comerciales y con aerolíneas”, apuntó.
La funcionaria estatal compartió que la promoción de un destino funciona como una pieza clave para atraer el turismo. Comparó que todos los años que habían sido récords en números no son fortuitos, pues consideró que se hizo un trabajo de promoción previo.
“Yo deseo que todo ese dinero que se está quedando en el fideicomiso, se permita que se utilice para reanudar la promoción”, opinó.
No obstante, Fridman Hirsch resaltó que en cuanto a los datos globales, el Estado continúa arriba en comparación al año pasado, pues de enero a la fecha se tienen indicadores positivos contra el 2023, que fue un año récord para la industria turística.
Añadió que este año sí hubo una menor promoción en el destino, pero reiteró que no fue por instrucciones o petición de la Sefotur, lo que dijo, está registrado en todas las sesiones del fideicomiso. Recordó que el monto que se queda en dicho fideicomiso asciende a más de 100 millones de pesos.
Pese a esto, estimó que para finales de año se volvería a tener un repunte en cuanto a la actividad turística, ya que el verano no es la mejor temporada para el Estado, de acuerdo con sus datos.
Como informamos ayer, la Cámara Nacional de Autotransporte, Pasaje y Turismo (Canapat) advirtió que por los datos preliminares que ya se tienen, en este verano no se podrá llegar a la meta de casi medio millón de pasajeros movilizados durante el verano en Yucatán, pero precisó que sí se tendrá una cifra de entre 450 mil y 460 mil personas en dicho lapso.
En ese mismo sentido, la Asociación Mexicana de Hoteles en el Estado (AMHY) también informó que no se había tenido la ocupación que se esperaba en el mes de julio por diferentes factores.

author: Danny Groves
title: Success! We help secure higher protection for endangered porpoise at UN meeting
text:
Success! We help secure higher protection for endangered porpoise at UN meeting
We are very excited to report that our work with other partner organisations has helped secure the highest level of protection for a critically endangered population of common
harbour porpoise in the central Baltic Sea, and off the Iberian Peninsula.
Only a few hundred of these porpoises are left alive and effective measures to enable their recovery have been lacking. But, following our hard work to change this perilous situation, the UN Convention of Migratory Species (CMS COP14) has agreed today to include the Baltic Proper harbour porpoise in its Appendix I category (the highest protection status), which formally recognises the population as critically endangered and means emergency measures can now be taken to save them.
Whale and Dolphin Conservation, Humane Society International, Coalition Clean Baltic and ORCA made a decisive contribution to the decision, submitting a
joint report to CMS calling for stronger protections for these specific harbour porpoise populations, and to restore their habitats. As a result, the CMS member states of the EU submitted a proposal for the harbour porpoise to be included in Appendix I of the Convention.
This new protection status enables priority conservation measures to be taken to prevent, remove or mitigate obstacles to their seasonal migration and to control other factors that might endanger their survival. The main threats to the Baltic proper harbour porpoise include bycatch, underwater noise and pollution.
The harbour porpoise is one of the smallest species within the larger family of cetaceans (whales, dolphins and porpoises). Previously, we conducted an awareness-raising
campaign for the Baltic Proper harbour porpoise with the aim of achieving a year-round ban on gillnets in marine protected areas. A petition with more than 100,000 signatures was submitted to the German government in September 2021. We also initiated an open letter to the German government, signed by more than 100 cetacean experts from around the world, calling for effective measures to protect the Baltic Proper harbour porpoise. Our educational work continues to this day.
